title: Inventor and InventHelp Client Develops Improved Automotive Radio (QCY-139)
text:
InventHelp is working to submit this idea, the ECK-O, to appropriate companies for their consideration and potential feedback.
PITTSBURGH, PA (PRWEB) October 17, 2015
"Sometimes a commercial will come on the radio while I am driving, and it will broadcast information that I need to write down, but I am driving, so I cannot get a pen and paper and take down notes," said an inventor from Spindale, N.C. "I came up with this idea to solve the problem."
He developed the patent-pending ECK-O to offer a convenient way to record radio content. The design enables the user to play back commercials, songs, interviews, talk shows, etc. It helps the user remember various things, such as website addresses and contact information. This eliminates the need to try to write down info while driving. The invention is designed to enhance automotive safety by minimizing distractions. Furthermore, it is easy to use.
The original design was submitted to the Charlotte office of InventHelp. It is currently available for licensing or sale to manufacturers or marketers. For more information, write Dept. 14-QCY-139, InventHelp, 217 Ninth Street, Pittsburgh, PA 15222, or call (412) 288-1300 ext. 1368. Learn more about InventHelp's Invention Submission Services at http://www.InventHelp.com - https://www.youtube.com/user/inventhelp
